Title.evidence: This study aimed to identify risk factors and develop prediction models for postoperative chronic opioid use (PCOU).

Trial_Design.evidence: This retrospective cohort study used data from the Korean National Health Insurance Service (NHIS) between January 2008 and December 2018.

Participants.evidence: Of 2 077 825 patients aged seven years or older who underwent surgery, survived at least one year, and had no additional surgeries, 1 108 119 were randomly selected.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to identify risk factors and develop prediction models for postoperative chronic opioid use (PCOU).

Method_Outcome.evidence: PCOU was defined as having filled 10 or more prescriptions or receiving more than 120 days’ supply between postoperative days 91 and 365.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 2 077 825 patients aged seven years or older who underwent surgery, survived at least one year, and had no additional surgeries, 1 108 119 were randomly selected.
